intro: Opsicarpium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the eastern United States. The plants are herbaceous perennials with basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped or ovate. They produce small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, often blooming in early spring. The fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature.
